column5: Hey guys so finally i am making my first fishing trip. We have decided to go up to Orangeville. Someone mentioned to me to try Island Lake conservation area  Can any one suggest any other spots or lakes we can access that we can get more action, we will only be doing fishing from the shore as dont have a boat.  any advice would be great. thanks
why arent you fishing around the Hammer LOTS AND LOTS OF FISH!!!!!!!
where and what is the hammer?
oh dear.  Have you lived in Hamilton very long, Lad?
ooohhhh sorry sorry gents, i actually dont live in hamilton any more i live in mississauga now. only lived in hamilton for 2 years - anyways so any suggests on orangeville fishing?

Check with the park beforehand to make sure that it's open.  It might still be closed.  Also, if you can, rent a boat & trolloing motor combo.  Prices have gone up a bit, but it won't break your bank.  Shore fishing is somewhat limited in that lake.
so do you know any other places in or around that area we can try that may be a bit better for shore fishing? also any suggestions on where i may be able to rent a boat?
You can rent a boat from the park.  Go here for details:  Island Lake  For other places close by, click this link for more info:  CVC
Hamilton Toronto Island Port Credit Mountsberg Bronte Creek Oakville Creek Anywhere there is a peir or Marina LAKE ONTARIO
DJ DANNNY D!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  When pike and bass open try pier 4. You will be surprised with some on the fish in thier.  (not 3 eyes and two heads, mostly thier size)
